ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ, pi júʼ! Pi ge túm ntse Juundʉŋ lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn, é zyɛ́ʼ kúu tsɛ̀ɛ mengwòŋ mie epʉ̀a ée wó ńgyɔ́ɔn ḿbiŋ ńtʉ ńcʉa gẅí, é kúu tsɛ̀ɛ memǎa metÿǒsoŋ mie metʉ̂ankáʼ mie mé la lɔg ńkéle, é kwɔ́ʼ kwɔ̌ʼ tà ńkíbe lefaŋ.
en: “Listen, Israel: Today you are about to cross the Jordan to enter and drive out nations greater and stronger than you,   with large cities fortified to the heavens.  # 9:1 Dt 1:28

ngiemboon: Pi ge lÿɔ́ʼ pʉ̀a Anag é jÿó, ée pʉ̀a ńtʉ ḿbiŋ ńgaʼ. Pi lǎ júʼ páʼ mé kíme wɔ́b ngie: «Ngwɔ́ wɔ̌ lÿɔ́ʼ pʉ̀a na tsìŋendá Anag tà ńjÿó?»
en: The people are strong and tall, the descendants of the Anakim.   You know about them and you have heard it said about them, ‘Who can stand up to the sons of Anak? ’  # 9:2 Nm 13:22; Jos 15:13–14; 21:11; Jdg 1:20

ngiemboon: Pi fó lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn ńzsé ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, kwàʼ yé zɔɔ mvfò pi ńgiŋe páʼ mmɔ̌g gẅie é tuɔ jʉʼ; yé zɔ ge gÿo pyága wɔ́b; é sẅíʼi nzẅìŋ wɔ́b, á mvfò pi; pi zyɛ́ʼ ńkú, ńdwo ḿbyága wɔ́b, páʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la gɔɔn né pi púʼu.
en: But understand that today the Lord your God will cross over ahead of you   as a consuming fire;  # 9:3 Ex 24:17; Dt 4:24; Is 29:6; 30:27,30; 33:14; Ezk 15:7; 19:12 he will devastate and subdue them before you. You will drive them out and destroy them swiftly,  # 9:3 Dt 12:2; Jos 23:13 as the Lord has told you.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, à lɔɔn ńgÿo ńgwɔ́ tà fó lejʉ́ŋ pi, ńtága wɔ́b, ndyɛ̀ʼ pi gɔɔn ngie á tíi nue Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ka lɔgɔ légwɔ́ gie pi ée ngàŋa nò nénʉ́, tá ńgÿo pi zyɛ́ʼ ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ wɔɔn ngwòŋ; tá mbà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ka gwaa tág mɔɔn mengwòŋ mvfò pi, ńtí pɔ́ fʉ̌ʼ menò mɔ́b.
en: When the Lord your God drives them out before you, do not say to yourself, ‘The Lord brought me in to take possession of this land because of my righteousness.’   Instead, the Lord will drive out these nations before you because of their wickedness.  # 9:4 Pr 11:5

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńdÿɔ́ʼ ngwòŋ wɔ́b tà ńjÿó, mbà á téen ńtíi ngie pi ee ndʉŋndʉŋ wɔ́, ńké těen ńtíi páʼ pi ee ngàŋa nò nénʉ́ wɔ́, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, ge gÿo gwaa tág pʉ̀a yɔɔn láʼ mvfò pi, é tíi menò tepòŋ mie pɔ́ fʉ̌ʼ; mbɔɔ lélɔg ńgÿo à mmó gie à la kʉa mbwó Ábalaham, Ésàg ńgÿo Yakwɔ̂b pie ée pamángʉanjʉʼ pí, lɔg ḿbumte.
en: You are not going to take possession of their land because of your righteousness or your integrity. Instead, the Lord your God will drive out these nations before you because of their wickedness, in order to fulfill the promise he swore to your ancestors Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, pi zsé mboŋó ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, à těen ńnáa wɔɔn ngwòŋ mbòŋo ngie pi zyɛ́ʼ ńkú, ńtíi nue pi ee ngàŋa nò nénʉ́ wɔ́. Pi zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ patʉʉtwó.
en: Understand that the Lord your God is not giving you this good land   to possess because of your righteousness, for you are a stiff-necked people.  # 9:6 Ex 32:9; 33:3,5; 34:9; Dt 9:13

ngiemboon: Pi kímte, tà pi lege páʼ pi ka gÿo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, gyáŋalóŋ, á nkùɔmekwaʼá, tà fó lyɛ̌ʼ gie pi la kẅɛɛ ngwòŋ Egíbtò ńgʉa ńkúu jʉʼɔɔn. Pi la tʉʉ twó mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: “Remember   and do not forget how you provoked the Lord your God in the wilderness. You have been rebelling against the Lord from the day you left the land of Egypt until you reached this place.

ngiemboon: Pi la tʉʉ twó mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, á Olɛb, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gyáŋa lóŋ, ńtí gẅí, tà ngwɔ́ lépyága gẅí.
en: You provoked the Lord at Horeb, and he was angry enough with you to destroy you.

ngiemboon: N da gwɔ́ tà ḿbʉ né lekwɛ́ lékaa melàŋa tóon, é melàŋa kʉ̀a gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la gÿo, pi lâ pɔ̌ gwa. N da tsẅé ndùm lekwɛ́ lyɛ̌ʼ láʼ móm lekùɔ né paletsẅɛ́ʼ móm lekùɔ té pfɛ́ɛ mmó, té nú ntse.
en: When I went up the mountain to receive the stone tablets, the tablets of the covenant   the Lord made with you, I stayed on the mountain forty days and forty nights. I did not eat food or drink water.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la ná melàŋa tóon mémbʉ́a né mèŋ. É gwɔ́ mie yé Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé la lɔg pɔ́ pwó yé, ńŋweʼe mmó mǒ; é gwɔ́ membʉ̌ mie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la fó tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g á ndùm lekwɛ́ ńtsẅi né pi, á lyɛ̌ʼ gie pi la pú ńcúʼte.
en: On the day of the assembly the Lord gave me the two stone tablets, inscribed by God’s finger.   The exact words were on them, which the Lord spoke to you from the fire on the mountain.  # 9:10 Dt 5:4,22; 10:4

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn melyɛ̌ʼ móm lekùɔ, lé paletsẅɛ́ʼ móm lekùɔ la gwɔ́ tà ńtɔ́g, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ná melàŋa tóon mémbʉ́a né mèŋ, é gwɔ́ melàŋa kʉ̀a.
en: The Lord gave me the two stone tablets, the tablets of the covenant, at the end of the forty days and forty nights.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la leen ńgɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: «Lwo fó jʉʼɔɔn ésẅɛ́ʼ. Á nue aláʼ jú ya gie ɔ̀ la fó ngwòŋ Egíbtò, ńkẅile la, á kéen ḿbú fʉa nò, pɔ́ kéen ḿbú ńgwáʼa mánzsè gẅie n da nyɛɛ wɔ́b; ńdɔ́ɔn tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ńdɔg ńnyɛte tútú.»
en: “The Lord said to me, ‘Get up and go down immediately from here. For your people whom you brought out of Egypt have acted corruptly. They have quickly turned from the way that I commanded them; they have made a cast image for themselves.’

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: «N gyǎ pʉ̀a pɔɔn, ée patʉʉtwó!
en: The Lord also said to me, ‘I have seen this people, and indeed, they are a stiff-necked people.

ngiemboon: Nyé wɔ́ɔn, m byága wɔ́b, ḿvéle mezíŋ mɔ́b ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, n ge gÿo gÿo ɔ̀ nuŋe ngwòŋ gẅie é pú ńtʉ, ḿbiŋ ńgyɔ́ɔn tà ńtɔ́g pʉ̀a apɛ̌.»
en: Leave me alone, and I will destroy them and blot out their name under heaven.   Then I will make you into a nation stronger and more numerous than they.’

ngiemboon: N da gwaa fó ndùm lekwɛ́ sẅɛ́ʼ, ńgẅiin melàŋa kʉ̀a mémbʉ́a mbwó mèŋ; emmɔ̌g pú ńgwɔ́ lekwɛ́.
en: “So I went back down the mountain, while it was blazing with fire, and the two tablets of the covenant were in my hands.

ngiemboon: N deen ńgyá mbà pi ka fʉa nò mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, ńdɔ́ɔn tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ńdɔg ńnyɛte múɔ fòŋ, ńgwóon fó na mánzsè gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la nyɛɛ gẅí, é sẅɛʼte nnɛ́.
en: I saw how you had sinned against the Lord your God; you had made a calf image for yourselves. You had quickly turned from the way the Lord had commanded for you.

ngiemboon: N da maʼ melàŋa tóon mémbʉ́a mie é laa mbwó mèŋ ssé, éshʉ́ate mvfò pi.
en: So I took hold of the two tablets and threw them from my hands, shattering them before your eyes.

ngiemboon: N da sẅɛ́ʼ, ńkẅíʼte ssé mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ésẅíŋte Ssé lyɛ̌ʼ láʼ móm lekùɔ, né paletsẅɛ́ʼ móm lekùɔ té pfɛ́ɛ mmó, té nú ntse, páʼ mvɔ̀gmvfò fʉ̀ʼ. Ńtí menò tepòŋ ntsèm mie pi ka fʉʼ. Pi ka fʉʼ nò mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńgÿo mmó gie à te kwoŋ.
en: I fell down like the first time in the presence of the Lord for forty days and forty nights; I did not eat food or drink water because of all the sin you committed, doing what was evil in the Lord’s sight and angering him.

ngiemboon: Anò pú ńgyáŋa yé tà á faʼa lépú ḿbyága gẅí. Oon, n da pɔ́gɔ gyáŋalóŋ ŋwɛ́ na yɔɔn fʉ̀ʼ tɛʼ. Táʼ, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gíŋe ńjúʼu sẅíŋtè yɔ́ɔn.
en: I was afraid of the fierce anger the Lord had directed against you,   because he was about to destroy you. But again the Lord listened to me on that occasion.  # 9:19 Dt 10:10

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la gíŋe ńgyáŋa lóŋ tɛʼ ńtí Áloŋ, tà ngwɔ́ légÿo á kwé. Táʼ, n da gíŋe sẅíŋte Ssé, ńtí Áloŋ fʉʼó ŋwɛ́.
en: The Lord was angry enough with Aaron to destroy him. But I prayed for Aaron at that time also.

ngiemboon: Tútú múɔ fòŋ gẅie pi la nyɛte, ńdɔg fʉa nò la, n da kaa ńtuɔ mmɔ̌g, éshʉ́ate mepàg mepàg, ńgwɔʼ tà á cʉ́ʼʉ pfɔ̌b, ńdeen ńké ḿbÿɛɛ pfɔ̌b ŋwɛ́ tsɛ̀ɛ tsitsyɛ̀ gie á fóo lekwɛ́ ńcwoŋo ńcʉ́me tsɛ̀ɛ fúʼ.
en: I took the sinful calf you had made and burned it. I crushed it, thoroughly grinding it to powder as fine as dust, and threw its dust into the stream that came down from the mountain.

ngiemboon: Pi la gíŋe ńgʉa Tambela pɔ́ Masa né Kimbelɔd-Tava ńgÿo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gyáŋa lóŋ.
en: “You continued to provoke the Lord at Taberah, Massah, and Kibroth-hattaavah.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la gwɔ́ tà fó Kandɛ́shÿè-Mbaneya, ńtsẅi né pi ngie: «Pi gʉa ńdÿɔ́ʼɔ wɔ́b, ńzyɛ́ʼ ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅie mèŋ n nǎ né pi.» Pi la tʉʉ twó, á na nò gie Cʉapʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, à la tsẅi né pi, pi la te júʼ, ḿbiŋ te zẅíŋe nò gie à gɔ̌ɔn wɔ́.
en: When the Lord sent you from Kadesh-barnea, he said, ‘Go up and possess the land I have given you’; you rebelled against the command of the Lord your God. You did not believe or obey him.

ngiemboon: Tà fó páʼ mèŋ ńne ńzsé gẅí, pi tʉʉ twó mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: You have been rebelling against the Lord ever since I have   known you.  # 9:24 Ps 95; 106

ngiemboon: N da nuŋe ssé mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ mvfò yé, á na melyɛʼɛ́ láʼ móm lekùɔ, pɔ́ paletsẅɛ́ʼ móm lekùɔ. Ńtí nue Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la gɔɔn ngie à ge pú pyága gẅí.
en: “I fell down in the presence of the Lord forty days and forty nights because the Lord had threatened to destroy you.

ngiemboon: N da sẅíŋte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńgɔɔn ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé, te pyág pʉ̀a pɔɔn, ée pʉ̀a pú pie ɔ̀ ka lɔgɔ legúʼ gù, ńgÿo mé nyé wɔ́b, é pie ɔ̀ la lɔgɔ máa ngʉ̀ʼ jù, éfó ngwòŋ Egíbtò ńkẅile wɔ́b.
en: I prayed to the Lord:

ngiemboon: Kímte megàŋafàʼ pú: á Ábalaham, á Ésàg ńgÿo Yakwɔ̂b, te líe tʉʉtwó pʉ̀a láʼ yɔɔn, te líe mefʉ̌ʼ menò mɔ́b, tà mbɔɔ mefʉa mɔ́b,
en: Remember your servants Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. Disregard this people’s stubbornness, and their wickedness and sin.

ngiemboon: ńdɔg ḿbɔ́g páʼ ngwɔ́ epʉ̀a ngwòŋ gẅie ɔ̀ ka fó wó ńkẅile wég gɔɔn ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ka te kuʼu le gÿo pɔ́ kúu tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅie à la kaʼa mbwó pɔ́b wɔ́, kà pɔ́ ngie à ka pʉa wɔ́b pʉa tá ńgÿo pɔ́ kẅɛ páʼ, à ge gʉa kwòŋotsẅɛ, é gÿo pɔ́ kwéte wɔ́ɔ.
en: Otherwise, those in the land you brought us from will say, ‘Because the Lord wasn’t able to bring them into the land he had promised them, and because he hated them, he brought them out to kill them in the wilderness.’

ngiemboon: Áa láʼ jú, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pú pie ɔ̀ la lɔg metʉ̀ mú pâ máa ngʉ̀ʼ jù, éfó ngwòŋ Egíbtò ńkẅile.»
en: But they are your people, your inheritance, whom you brought out by your great power and outstretched arm.
